byline.original: By James F. Clarity and Warren Weaver Jr

docs.lead_paragraph: Speaking for Moynihan Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan, the New York Democrat, has a new press secretary. He is Lance Morgan, a native of Queens, who has worked for the last six years in Washington as a correspondent for two English newspapers, The Yorkshire Post and The Birmingham Evening News. Before that, he worked as a journalist in Buffalo. Mr. Morgan, who is 32 years old, is a graduate of Colgate University and the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism. He replaces Michael D. McCurry, who left Mr. Moynihan last month to become press secretary for Senator John Glenn.
